channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for renovations after a wave of canceled shows due to Trump adding his name to the building
item.description: Trump announced the closure days after the premiere of “Melania” a documentary of the first lady was shown at the storied venue.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1689 Hints And Answer For Monday, February 2
item.description: Looking for help with today's New York Times Wordle? Here are some expert hints, clues and commentary to help you solve today's Wordle and sharpen you...

item.title: NYT Pips Today: Hints, Answers And Walkthrough For Monday, February 2
item.description: Looking for help with today's New York Times Pips? We'll walk you through today's puzzle and help you match dominoes to tiles.

item.title: Trump’s plan to make housing affordable is faltering
item.description: “We’re not going to destroy the value of their homes so somebody who didn’t work very hard can buy a home,” Trump said.

item.title: Waymo seeking about $16 billion near $110 billion valuation
item.description: The parent company would provide about $13 billion to the robotaxi firm, while the rest would come from others, including new investors Sequoia Capita...

item.title: Samsung Confirms Ground-Breaking Galaxy S26 Ultra Feature
item.description: While we’re waiting for Samsung to announce its next flagship phones, the company has unveiled a killer new feature. Here’s what it is and why it’s so...

item.title: SpaceX seeks FCC nod to build data center constellation in space
item.description: SpaceX said it’s creating the solar-powered network in order to “accommodate the explosive growth of data demands driven by AI.”

item.title: Disney may soon have a new CEO. Here’s who it might be.
Here’s what’s worth streaming in February on Netflix, Hulu, Peacock and more
Oracle amps up its AI bet with a plan to raise as much as $50 billion this year
This ‘mutually assured destruction’ threat in the $7.3 trillion JGB market helps prevent Japan from triggering a debt crisis — for now
item.description: "Yet the JGB has unique features going for it, which limit the odds that the next debt crisis will be made in Japan."

item.title: New SNAP work requirements take effect in more states under Trump-backed law
item.description: New SNAP work requirements are taking effect in additional states, expanding eligibility rules and reshaping benefits under a Trump-backed law.

item.title: A Psychologist Shares A Fun Quiz That Reveals Your True ‘Psychological Age’ — And What It Says About You
item.description: Forget your birth date. Here’s how your cognitive habits and emotional maturity reveal the real age of your mind.

item.title: Costco issues recall notice for bakery item due to undeclared allergen
item.description: Costco has recalled mislabeled "Mini Beignets filled with Caramel" that could cause allergic reactions due to undeclared tree nuts in 22 states.

item.title: Why Revolut Pivots To Standalone US Bank License Strategy
item.description: This $75 billion giant is betting on a new path to conquer American finance. This is what changed and why.

item.title: U.S. stock futures fall, along with bitcoin and oil prices

item.description: Business leaders praised Trump's nomination of Kevin Warsh as Federal Reserve chairman, citing his extensive experience and proven crisis management e...

item.title: Trump picks veteran staffer to head Bureau of Labor Statistics
item.description: President Trump plans to nominate economist Brett Matsumoto to head the Bureau of Labor Statistics, elevating a career staffer who has worked at the a...

item.title: Who is Kevin Warsh, Trump's pick to succeed Jerome Powell as Fed chair?
item.description: President Donald Trump announced on Friday that he is nominating former Federal Reserve Governor Kevin Warsh to become chairman of the central bank.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
